# Implementation Tasks: NVIDIA Isaac AI Robotics (Isaac Sim, Isaac ROS, Nav2)

**Feature**: Module 3: The AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaacâ„¢)
**Branch**: `003-isaac-ai-brain`
**Date**: 2025-01-01
**Status**: Generated by `/sp.tasks`
**Input**: Feature specification from `/specs/003-isaac-ai-brain/spec.md`

## Summary

Create a comprehensive Docusaurus module for AI robotics using NVIDIA Isaac technologies, covering Isaac Sim for photorealistic simulation, Isaac ROS for hardware-accelerated VSLAM, and Nav2 for humanoid path planning. The implementation will include structured chapters as .md files organized for easy navigation, targeting AI students and developers learning perception and navigation intelligence.

## Implementation Strategy

- **MVP Scope**: Complete User Story 1 (Isaac Sim for Photorealistic Simulation) with basic examples and navigation
- **Delivery Approach**: Incremental delivery with each user story as an independently testable increment
- **Testing**: Verify Docusaurus build and navigation after each phase

## Dependencies

- User Story 1 (P1) should be completed before User Story 2 (P2)
- User Story 2 (P2) should be completed before User Story 3 (P3)
- Foundational tasks must be completed before any user story tasks

## Parallel Execution Examples

- Within each user story: Content creation can be parallelized with navigation updates
- Documentation for different Isaac ROS packages can be developed in parallel

## Phase 1: Setup Tasks

### Project Initialization

- [x] T002 Verify Docusaurus build process works with new directory structure

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Isaac Sim for Photorealistic Simulation (Priority: P1)

### Goal
AI students and developers can create photorealistic simulation environments in NVIDIA Isaac Sim to generate synthetic data for training perception models. This includes setting up realistic lighting, materials, and sensor configurations that closely match real-world conditions for effective robot perception training.

### Independent Test Criteria
Students can create a basic Isaac Sim environment with photorealistic rendering and generate synthetic sensor data that matches real-world patterns, delivering immediate value for perception model training. This delivers immediate value by enabling synthetic data generation for perception model training.

### Tasks

- [x] T007 [US1] Create comprehensive content for isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md covering Isaac Sim installation
- [x] T008 [P] [US1] Document Isaac Sim hardware requirements and system setup in isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T009 [P] [US1] Add photorealistic environment creation tutorials to isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T010 [P] [US1] Create synthetic data generation workflows content in isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T011 [P] [US1] Add lighting and material configuration examples to isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T012 [P] [US1] Include sensor configuration and domain randomization content in isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T013 [P] [US1] Add troubleshooting section for common Isaac Sim issues in isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T014 [US1] Update navigation links in sidebar for Isaac Sim chapter
- [x] T015 [US1] Add cross-references to related topics in isaac-sim-photorealistic-simulation.md
- [x] T016 [US1] Verify Docusaurus build with Isaac Sim content
- [x] T017 [US1] Test navigation and content readability for Isaac Sim chapter

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Isaac ROS for VSLAM and Navigation (Priority: P2)

### Goal
AI students and developers can implement hardware-accelerated Visual SLAM (VSLAM) using Isaac ROS packages to enable real-time navigation and mapping for robots. This includes integrating GPU-accelerated computer vision algorithms with ROS for efficient processing.

### Independent Test Criteria
Students can configure and run Isaac ROS VSLAM packages that process visual data in real-time with performance improvements over standard CPU-based approaches, delivering value for navigation applications.

### Tasks

- [x] T018 [US2] Create comprehensive content for isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md covering Isaac ROS installation
- [x] T019 [P] [US2] Document Isaac ROS VSLAM packages setup in isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T020 [P] [US2] Add hardware acceleration configuration guides to isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T021 [P] [US2] Create VSLAM implementation tutorials in isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T022 [P] [US2] Include performance optimization tips in isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T023 [P] [US2] Add camera calibration and image processing examples to isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T024 [P] [US2] Document Isaac ROS to Nav2 integration in isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T025 [US2] Update navigation links in sidebar for Isaac ROS chapter
- [x] T026 [US2] Add cross-references to related topics in isaac-ros-vslam-navigation.md
- [x] T027 [US2] Verify Docusaurus build with Isaac ROS content
- [x] T028 [US2] Test navigation and content readability for Isaac ROS chapter

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Nav2 for Humanoid Path Planning (Priority: P3)

### Goal
AI students and developers can configure Nav2 for bipedal humanoid robots to plan and execute complex navigation paths that account for the unique kinematics and balance requirements of two-legged locomotion.

### Independent Test Criteria
Students can configure Nav2 to plan paths for humanoid robots that consider balance, step placement, and bipedal kinematics, delivering value for advanced navigation scenarios.

### Tasks

- [x] T029 [US3] Create comprehensive content for nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md covering Nav2 setup for humanoid robots
- [x] T030 [P] [US3] Add humanoid-specific configuration parameters to nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T031 [P] [US3] Document footstep planning algorithms in nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T032 [P] [US3] Create path planning tutorials with humanoid constraints in nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T033 [P] [US3] Add center of mass (CoM) and balance considerations to nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T034 [P] [US3] Include obstacle avoidance examples in nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T035 [P] [US3] Document Nav2 to Isaac Sim integration for testing in nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T036 [US3] Update navigation links in sidebar for Nav2 chapter
- [x] T037 [US3] Add cross-references to related topics in nav2-humanoid-path-planning.md
- [x] T038 [US3] Verify Docusaurus build with Nav2 content
- [x] T039 [US3] Test navigation and content readability for Nav2 chapter

## Success Criteria Verification

- [ ] SC-001: Students can create a basic Isaac Sim environment with photorealistic rendering in under 60 minutes (verifiable through US1 content)
- [ ] SC-002: Synthetic data generated in Isaac Sim results in perception models with at least 80% accuracy on real-world data (verifiable through US1 content)
- [ ] SC-003: Isaac ROS VSLAM implementation processes visual data in real-time (30 FPS) with hardware acceleration (verifiable through US2 content)
- [ ] SC-004: 85% of students successfully complete the Isaac Sim to Nav2 implementation pipeline without requiring additional support (verifiable through complete module)
- [ ] SC-005: Nav2 path planning for humanoid robots accounts for bipedal kinematics with at least 90% success rate in obstacle avoidance (verifiable through US3 content)
- [ ] SC-006: Students can transition from Isaac Sim synthetic data generation to real-world robot deployment within 8 hours of instruction (verifiable through complete module)
